api_db_test_auth_failed: Authentication failed. Please check your username and password.
api_db_test_auth_denied: Access denied. The user does not have permission to access this database.
api_db_test_conn_refused: Connection refused. Please check if the database server is running and the port is correct.
api_db_test_host_not_found: Host not found. Please check the hostname or IP address.
api_db_test_timeout: Connection timed out. Please check if the database server is reachable.
api_db_test_tls_error: TLS/SSL connection error. Please check your security settings.
api_db_test_invalid_uri: Invalid connection string. Please check your host and port configuration.
api_db_test_invalid_port: Invalid port number. Please enter a valid port (e.g., 27017 for MongoDB).
api_db_test_invalid_hostname: Invalid hostname. Please check the hostname or IP address format.
api_db_test_unexpected_error: An unexpected error occurred. Please check your configuration and try again.
api_db_test_conn_unauthorized: Connection successful, but not authorized. Please provide user credentials with permissions to proceed.
api_db_test_unsupported_db: Database type not yet supported for testing
api_db_test_db_not_found: Database not found. Please check the database name and ensure it exists.
setup_email_test_success_desc: Your SMTP configuration has been verified successfully. We sent a test email to confirm everything is working.
setup_email_why_desc: Configuring SMTP allows SveltyCMS to send emails for:
setup_email_skip_note: You can skip this step and configure it later in Settings.
setup_email_help_provider: Select a preset for common email providers or 'Custom SMTP' to enter your own details.
setup_email_preset_note_gmail: For Gmail, you may need to use an App Password if 2FA is enabled.
setup_email_preset_note_sendgrid: Use 'apikey' as the username and your API key as the password.
setup_email_help_host: The hostname of your SMTP server (e.g., smtp.example.com).
setup_email_help_port: The port your SMTP server listens on (usually 587 or 465).
setup_email_help_user: Your SMTP username (often your email address).
setup_email_help_password: Your SMTP password or App Password.
setup_email_from_note: The email address that will appear in the 'From' field. Defaults to username if empty.
setup_email_test_required: Please fill in all required fields to test the connection
setup_troubleshoot_atlas_ip_1: Go to MongoDB Atlas > Network Access
setup_troubleshoot_atlas_ip_4: Or add 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all (dev only)
setup_troubleshoot_atlas_ip_5: Wait 1-2 minutes for changes to propagate
setup_troubleshoot_cluster_1: Check if the cluster name is correct
setup_troubleshoot_cluster_3: Ensure the cluster is not paused
setup_troubleshoot_cluster_4: Check DNS resolution for the cluster
setup_troubleshoot_user_1: Go to MongoDB Atlas > Database Access
setup_troubleshoot_auth_3: Check for special characters in password
setup_troubleshoot_auth_5: Try creating a new database user
setup_troubleshoot_creds_2: Provide a valid username and password
setup_troubleshoot_creds_4: Check if the database supports anonymous access
setup_troubleshoot_host_1: Check if the hostname/IP is correct
setup_troubleshoot_host_2: Ensure the database server is running
setup_troubleshoot_host_3: Check if the port is correct (default: 27017)
setup_troubleshoot_host_5: Try pinging the host from your terminal
setup_troubleshoot_dbnotfound_1: Check if the database name is correct
setup_troubleshoot_timeout_2: Verify the database server is reachable
setup_troubleshoot_timeout_4: Check for network firewalls blocking access
setup_troubleshoot_timeout_5: Ensure the server is not under heavy load
setup_troubleshoot_default_2: Review the error message for clues
setup_troubleshoot_default_3: Consult the documentation for your database
setup_troubleshoot_default_4: Search for the error code online
setup_troubleshoot_default_5: Contact support if the issue persists
